question_text: How would you design a highly scalable and cost-effective serverless architecture on GCP to power a Generative AI application using the Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) pattern?
hook_text: Build a RAG system on Google Cloud that scales automatically and keeps costs low!
cta_text: Follow for daily Cloud Architect tips and stay ahead!

answer_sections.title: Data Ingestion & Embeddings
answer_sections.text: Ingest data, create embeddings, store in Vertex AI Vector Search.
answer_sections.spoken_audio: Raw data lands in Cloud Storage. Cloud Functions or Dataflow generate embeddings with Vertex AI, then store them efficiently in Vertex AI Vector Search for retrieval.

answer_sections.title: Query Processing with LLM
answer_sections.text: Cloud Run service queries Vector Search, prompts Vertex AI Gemini.
answer_sections.spoken_audio: User requests are handled by a Cloud Run service. It retrieves relevant context from Vector Search and constructs a prompt for the Vertex AI Gemini model for accurate responses.

answer_sections.title: Deployment & Observability
answer_sections.text: Deploy with Cloud Build, monitor with Cloud Monitoring & Logging.
answer_sections.spoken_audio: Automate deployment via Cloud Build. Cloud Monitoring provides performance metrics and alerts, while Cloud Logging captures detailed logs for robust debugging and observability.

diagrams.dsl: (User Request) -> [Cloud Run Service] --> "Retrieve Context" [[Vertex AI Vector Search]] --> "Augment Prompt" [Vertex AI Gemini] -> (Response)
